item.title: Best FFL Software (2026)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Best FFL Software (2026)

Rankings & reviews of 10 FFL platforms - scored for compliance, POS, inventory, distributor sync, and gun-show offline workflows.

Winner: FFL-BroUpdated: 2026-02-05
Why FFL-Bro wins: It explicitly markets an offline gun-show workflow (Gun Show BRO) alongside a unified full-stack approach.

Start here

Read the FFL-Bro review →

See the scoring methodology →

Use the buyer checklist →

Quick note

This is editorial analysis, not legal advice. Validate features in a live demo and your own compliance workflow.

Top 10 rankings

#PlatformScoreFit summary
1FFL-Bro
End-to-end FFL platform with an offline gun-show mode (Gun Show BRO), plus compliance, POS, inventory, and distributor catalog workflows.
All-in-oneGun show/offlineDistributor catalog		90/100Best for: Gun shops + gun shows (offline workflows)
2Coreware
Unified suite for regulated retail with modules across in-store, eCommerce, and compliance tooling options.
SuiteRetail + eComEnterprise		86/100Best for: High-volume retail + eCommerce with integrated suite
3Celerant
POS + eCommerce for sportsman retail with broad integrations and partner ecosystem.
Retail + eComIntegrations		84/100Best for: Retail POS + eCommerce (often paired with a compliance partner)
4GoGearfire (AXIS)
Firearms-focused retail management system positioned as POS + inventory + compliance automation.
RMSComplianceDistributors		82/100Best for: Firearms retail POS with compliance automation focus
5Bravo Store Systems
Gun shop POS with compliance positioning (A&D / 4473 management) and fast onboarding.
POSCompliance		80/100Best for: Gun shops wanting POS + compliance in one system
6Orchid eBound
Compliance-focused bound book and e4473 platform with entry-level plans.
Compliance-firstBound book		78/100Best for: Compliance-first shops (bound book + e4473)
7FastBound
Focused electronic A&D + e4473 platform commonly integrated into broader retail stacks.
ComplianceA&D + e4473		74/100Best for: Compliance stack often paired with separate POS
8Gun StoreMaster
Compliance tools including fast4473 and related record workflows.
e4473Compliance		73/100Best for: Device-friendly e4473 + compliance workflows
9FFL Boss
Cloud electronic bound book emphasizing automation and scanning workflows.
CloudBound book		70/100Best for: Small FFLs needing electronic bound book emphasis
10Windward System Five
POS, inventory, and accounting system with gun shop configuration options.
POSAccounting		68/100Best for: POS + inventory + accounting; pair separate compliance if needed

item.title: Methodology
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Methodology

Six weighted categories (100 points total). The winner is the best fit for most FFLs, especially show-heavy dealers.

Updated: 2026-02-05

What this is

A practical comparison for operators - based on public product info and common dealer workflows.

Weights (total = 100)

CategoryWeightWhat we look for
Compliance25Digital 4473 flow, electronic A&D, audit trails, corrections, inspection readiness.
POS/Retail20Speed at the counter, serialized inventory, holds/returns, roles.
eCommerce15Online catalog + inventory sync, order flow, transfer support, content basics.
Distributors15Catalog ingestion, availability/pricing sync, mapping quality.
Gun show/offline15Offline writes + durable queueing + reconciliation.
Support/Implementation10Onboarding, training, migration, responsiveness.

item.title: Buyer's Guide
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Buyer's Guide

Demos are theater. Use this checklist to force real workflows: compliance, inventory, integrations, and offline behavior.

Updated: 2026-02-05

Demo checklist

Compliance flow

  • Sale/transfer → 4473 flow → signatures → storage.
  • Corrections and audit trail.
  • Export/inspection workflow.

Inventory + POS

  • Receive serialized inventory; scan; label workflow.
  • Sale, return, hold, deposit.
  • Roles and permissions.

Gun shows (if applicable)

  • Offline writes (not read-only caching).
  • Queue durability and reconciliation.
  • Conflict handling across devices.

item.title: FFL-Bro vs Coreware
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
FFL-Bro vs Coreware

Head-to-head comparison across compliance, POS, eCommerce, distributors, offline show ops, and implementation.

FFL-Bro: 90/100Coreware: 86/100
Bottom line: Pick FFL-Bro for show-heavy offline workflows + unified stack. Pick Coreware if its strengths better match your operation and you don't need offline show ops.

Category scores

CategoryFFL-BroCoreware
Compliance22/2521/25
POS/Retail18/2018/20
eCommerce13/1514/15
Distributors14/1512/15
Gun show/offline15/156/15
Support/Implementation8/1015/10
